text.__SUMMARY__: Rhododendron polycladum (多枝杜鹃) is a rhododendron species native to central and northwestern Yunnan in China, where it grows at altitudes of 3000–4300 meters. It is a shrub that grows to 1.2 m in height, with leaves that are narrowly elliptic, elliptic, oblong, or lanceolate, 0.6–1.5 by 0.2–0.4 cm in size. Flowers are lavender to purple-blue.
text.Synonyms:
Rhododendron compactum Hutch.
Rhododendron scintillans Balf. f. & W.W. Sm.
text.References:
"Rhododendron polycladum", Franchet, Bull. Soc. Bot. France. 33: 234. 1886.
